stream_context.summary: Kaze fine-tunes overworld visuals—mainly plants, corals, cave, volcano, and lighthouse shaders—to ready the area for first external beta testing while staying within N64 hardware limits.

development_findings.summary: Goal is to finish overworld shaders (plants, corals, volcano rock, cave entry, lighthouse) so the build can be sent to beta testers imminently.
development_findings.quote: I was working on this level today. I wanna get this ready for beta testing so we can ship it off to the beta testers.

development_findings.summary: Uses 64 MB ROM cap; refuses larger cartridges or extra hardware to keep authenticity.
development_findings.quote: I limited myself to exactly 64 megabytes. The final ROM is probably going to be exactly 64 megabytes.

development_findings.summary: Overworld will not display Banjo-Kazooie style level nameplates to maintain a "placey" rather than "gamey" feel.
development_findings.quote: Nope. That makes the overworld feel very gamey and I want this to feel placey.

development_findings.summary: Introduced cut-scene skip concept: holding A shows a fast-forward icon with a Breath-of-the-Wild-style radial timer; after ~30 frames the scene aborts.
development_findings.quote: As you hold the A button, the circle slowly fills… once you hold A for 30 frames, this happens. The cutscene just stops, and you're right in the action.

development_findings.summary: Entrance design: Pak E. Derm NPC blocks bunny burrow; player can pay 10 coins or ground-pound beside him to flip him, echoing Yoshi’s Story.
development_findings.quote: He's gonna be like, get me 10 coins, or I won’t let you in. …or you can do a ground pound next to him, just like in Yoshi's Story, which will flip him over.

development_findings.summary: Reflection combiner planned for lighthouse based on earlier metallic shader; Fast64 preview/export bug forces the reflective texture into a separate file and requires debugging.
development_findings.quote: We had to put the reflective texture into a whole separate file because Fast64 would export it wrong.

development_findings.summary: Water and rain effects now fully 3-D and world-space; Kaze proud of performance on N64 hardware.
development_findings.quote: Oh, the rain in the ship level is genuine 3D rain in world space, and I like it that way.

development_findings.summary: Combiner space limits force compromises (e.g., cannot darken flower interiors independently).
development_findings.quote: The only thing I don't like is that the flowers are still right here. But I don't think I have the combiner space to fix that.

development_findings.summary: Fast64 preview multiplies alpha incorrectly, causing mis-coloured textures during editing; needs upstream fix.
development_findings.quote: If the plugin exported my texture correctly, that pattern is not there. … I will have to debug this upstream.

development_findings.summary: Considering buying all original Mario 64 instrument samples so RTYI soundtrack could legally be sold in future.
development_findings.quote: I should just buy all the samples used in the Mario 64 OST because what if at some point I wanna sell the RTYI OST

context_findings.summary: Kaze is balancing development with a full-time Unreal Engine 5 job, YouTube channel, sponsors, and a young daughter.
context_findings.quote: I do have a full-time job outside of making this game… I have a daughter.

context_findings.summary: Outsources video editing and now uses sponsorships to fund it, acknowledging channel has become more commercial.
context_findings.quote: I ended up paying someone to make videos for me… and now I actually make way more money from YouTube videos, because I have sponsors.

context_findings.summary: Self-assesses as a top 2–3 % programmer who enjoys low-level optimization and began assembly only five years ago.
context_findings.quote: No bragging… I do think, skill-wise, I'm at least a top 2 % or 3 % programmer.

context_findings.summary: Expresses frustration with Stack Overflow’s dismissive responses; prefers blunt but correct feedback.
context_findings.quote: Most of the time it's like, 'Oh you're a f***ing idiot,' and then it's worse because they don't understand the issue—that's what bothers me.

context_findings.summary: Invests in stock market, calls it gambling; debates audience reaction to potential gambling sponsorship.
context_findings.quote: Honestly, I am a gambler. Because even now I am still invested in the stock market.

context_findings.summary: Keeps Patreon Discord low-traffic; views it as space for hardcore followers (posts 1-2× year).
context_findings.quote: The Patreon discord I kinda consider like the hardcore audience… maybe like once or twice a year.

context_findings.summary: Prefers authenticity over expansion hardware; philosophy: stronger hardware trades dev effort for performance but he enjoys optimizing.

biobak.summary: Will later overhaul current placeholder textures; Kaze intentionally leaves visuals rough so Biobak can "make this look really good in the end."
biobak.quote: Biobak is gonna rework some of this anyway.

biobak.summary: Provided vine texture reference Kaze is now using.
biobak.quote: Biobak showed this to me just recently.

zeina.summary: Likely designing cut-scene skip UI; Kaze asks if she finished the skip button graphic.
zeina.quote: Zeina did you end up making the skip button?

key_stories.title: Cut-scene Skip Feature
key_stories.summary: Kaze wants players to bypass cinematic sequences smoothly. He proposes holding A to charge a fast-forward icon, after which the cut-scene instantly ends.
key_stories.challenge: Long unskippable cut-scenes break pacing and replayability.
key_stories.process: Ideated Breath-of-the-Wild–style radial timer; asks Zeina for button UI; plans 30-frame hold threshold.
key_stories.outcome: Design approved on stream; implementation pending Zeina’s asset and coding.
key_stories.key_quote: Once you hold A for 30 frames, the cutscene just stops and you're right in the action.

key_stories.title: Pak E. Derm Gate
key_stories.summary: Entrance to Bunny Burrow looks welcoming yet is blocked by a guard from Yoshi’s Story. Players can bribe him or flip him, adding choice and humor.
key_stories.challenge: Need engaging gate that fits narrative while teaching mechanics.
key_stories.process: Imported character; set coin fee; designed alternative ground-pound bypass.
key_stories.outcome: Mechanic finalized; shader and plant work adjusted to make entrance visually inviting.
key_stories.key_quote: They want me to go here, but this asshole won't let me.

key_stories.title: Lighthouse Reflection Shader Bug
key_stories.summary: Kaze attempts metallic reflection on lighthouse using custom combiner but Fast64 exports textures incorrectly, showing wrong colours in editor.
key_stories.challenge: Implement advanced reflection within N64 limits while battling toolchain errors.
key_stories.process: Separated reflective texture into its own file; tests different combiners; identifies alpha-preview multiplication bug.
key_stories.outcome: Shader works in-game but needs upstream fix for editor; debugging postponed for next session.
key_stories.key_quote: We had to put the reflective texture into a whole separate file because Fast64 would export it wrong.
